name: Pork Chops in Mustard Cream Sauce
ingredients: 4 bone-­‐in pork loin chops (1 in. thick, trimmed) ¼ c. half and half cream
2 Tbsp. vegetable oil ¼. c. sour cream
steps: ¼ c. plus 2 tsp. flour, divided 2 garlic cloves, minced
½ tsp. salt 1 c. beef broth
¼ tsp. pepper ½ tsp. dried rosemary, crushed
½ pound fresh mushrooms, sliced 1 Tbsp. Dijon mustard
In a large resealable plastic bag, combine ¼ c. flour, salt and pepper. Add pork chops, one at a time, and shake to coat.
In a large skillet, brown chops in oil over medium-­‐high heat for 3-­‐4 min. on each side. Remove and set aside. In the same
skillet, sauté mushrooms and garlic for 3 min. Add broth and rosemary; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low; return pork
to pan. Cover and simmer for 1 hour or until meat is very tender. Remove pork and keep warm. In a small bowl, combine
the half and half, sour cream, mustard and remaining flour until smooth. Pour into skillet. Bring to a boil; cook and stir
for 2 minutes, or until thickened. Serve over pork chops.
